qas.question: During what decade did food become an important aspect of a pub's business?
Along with dinners, what meals do modern pubs often serve?
What is a term for pubs that serve restaurant-quality food?
Other than the bar, in what room might patrons of a pub eat?

context: Since <a0_0>the 1990s<a0_0/> food has become a more important part of a pub's trade, and today most pubs serve <a1_0>lunches<a1_0/> and dinners at the table in addition to (or instead of) snacks consumed at the bar. They may have a separate <a3_0>dining room<a3_0/>. Some pubs serve meals to a higher standard, to match good restaurant standards; these are sometimes termed <a2_0>gastropubs<a2_0/>.
